column4: I lost my wireless card //// I didn't do a kernel upgrade.  It looks like it still is working (sending packets) driver adm8211 is present (lshw)  My laptop can see the singnal in the same spot but the card stoped working (sencond time it happened, last time I reinstalled_)  what next
any help??
so, what did you do to loose your wireless card?
the only thing I think of is install samba
that's the last thing I can think of
and it used to work perfectly, before?
yes
I'm curious, the previous time you lost your wireless card, did it happen after installing samba as well, or something else?
can't say I was putting the card in to replace a crappy prism card and had the same problem driver pleasent but no go (same card worked out of the box on other systems)
well, I dunno how to help you, but you could search dmesg for errors
no need to repeat yourself
I'm stuck and desperate man :)
what kind of troubleshooting have you done so far?
if the live CD gives you the same problem, try powering down your card+ computer for a minute to let it completely loose it's internal memory state, then try again
did the live cd work work good at first, before you installed samba?
then your card must be broken
if it's a laptop, try completely taking the card out
answer my last question about the live cd
yeah, did the wireless card ever work with the live cd?
never had to use it before so it's not a great check
I'm out of ideas
thanks for trying.... I need to get it up.  I'm taking the laptop on a long trip and my wife needs the desktop up and running
